Message.Title: First AAPl now GOOG
Message.Msg: Wall Street was upgrading AAPL at $700 and GOOG at $840-. The day it was UPgraded and it hit $839 I suggested SELL into STRENGTH. The past month, there was four ..$20 trading ranges and one $40 range. First, $800, then $794 were the floors. Wall Street wants it lower for the sling shot for earnings? But Oppenheimer said GOOG revenues would be 3% shy of estimates. When AAPl revenues were shy AAP: fell $100? You can hold and sell a Jan 2014 call for $60 a share then do what I suggested at 3:30 on earnings day

Message.Title: Facebook is inserting itself between users and Google.
Message.Msg: Facebook's HOME: "Facebook is inserting itself between users and Google, diverting them to the social network's own ads and services. It's taking advantage of the fact that Google places few restrictions on how phone manufacturers and software developers modify Android. By contrast, Facebook Home would not work on the iPhone without approval from Apple Inc., and close collaboration with the company. "Facebook Home can only reside on Android because only Google was daft enough to allow it," said independent phone analyst Horace Dediu"

Message.Title: Undiscovered Leader of Booming Tech Industry, Low Float, Breaking Out
Message.Msg: Most likely you never heard of Concurrent (CCUR) but if you're a cable TV subscriber to cable TV there's a pretty good chance you use their video on demand (VOD) technology many times each month. CCUR's VOD technology is the most widely used worldwide with a reach of 50mm homes. CCUR was first company ever to launch a commercial VOD service for their client Time Warner Cable (TWC) and they also deployed TWC's start-over and look-back services. TWC is now on their 6th generation of CCUR's technology. CCUR on Monday will unveil major new technology that will allow its clients to monetize the industry's 6.8 billion free on demand streams being watched each year, by inserting targeted video ads on the fly while the content is being streamed. CCUR's EPS is rapidly growing on a quarter-to-quarter basis. Cable TV operators this year will rush to upgrade their VOD systems to support multi-screen video delivery (tablets, smartphones, etc.) and CCUR latest generation of their VOD technology supports multi-screen video delivery to all IP-connected devices! CCUR is only $7.39 has huge cash position of $24.6mm and is paying a big dividend. Enterprise value is only $43.39mm or 0.69x revenue! Cisco (CSCO) and Netflix (NFLX) are CCUR's cloest competitors with similar margins and they're being valued at enterprise value/revenue ratios that would value CCUR at $15!
